@TheBlueMatt @BitPay you mean conflicting chaindb transactions?  if so, that would be an invalid block
@TheBlueMatt @BitPay 140 characters is really limiting to answer these questions
@TheBlueMatt @BitPay yes ...you could effect a double spend like attack (where "double spend" is generalized to "conflicting updates")
@TheBlueMatt @BitPay chaindb doesn't have miners, it has bidders, bitcoin miners can create chaindb blocks (if it's a public chain)
@TheBlueMatt @BitPay it's not an altcoin framework
@TheBlueMatt @BitPay yes, randomized selection mitigates but doesn't eliminate this issue (exploring ideas to up the cost of this attack)
@TheBlueMatt @BitPay yes (but this is not a big of a deal as many might imagine)
@TheBlueMatt @BitPay correct (though some chains might need even less frequency)...but definitely no more than one per bitcoin block
@TheBlueMatt @BitPay actually reorgs of the bitcoin chain are expected and cause corresponding chaindb reorgs
@TheBlueMatt @BitPay that's an artifact to trying to get the essential ideas across without getting mired in the implementation details
